intro: Selinum aureum, commonly known as golden selenium, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring to early summer. Its foliage is aromatic and has been used historically in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Selinum aureum prefers well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable addition to rock gardens or borders.
